Edit: At first I just opened the .iso file with vlc, but to get around the problem stated above, I mounted the *.iso file in deamon and then threw the *.vob files (skip*_0.vob) into vlc which got me passes the security message.

Trying to rip this? DVDShrink (http://www.doom9.org/software.htm) doesn't like the VTS and this can be easily fixed using FixVTS http://www.videohelp.com/tools/FixVTS

Thanks for the great share.

If ripping subs, for those wanting the film in English with ONLY English subtitles on the Russian parts the 3rd English subtitles (smallest file 0.35mb I think) is the correct file. In DVDShrink you can make it the default subtitle or force it with IFOEdit (http://www.google.co.uk/search?hl=en&q=ifoedit&btnG=Google+Search&meta=)
